abstract: Adam Liptak Sidebar column notes letter sent by Illinois Atty Gen Lisa Madigan to United States Supreme Court, accusing Gov Bruce Rauner of having violated law by filing brief in case concerning state public unions; Madigan argues that neither Gov Rauner nor his attorneys have legal authority to represent Illinois in any court, and that such representation can only be made by state attorney general, Illinois's chief legal officer.
lead_paragraph: The state’s attorney general has contested a filing by Gov. Bruce Rauner in a case about unions, saying the governor has no authority to represent the state in court.

headline.main: It’s Illinois v. Illinois in Supreme Court Duel for Justices’ Attention
headline.print_headline: It’s Illinois v. Illinois in Supreme Court Duel for Justices’ Attention

snippet: The state’s attorney general has contested a filing by Gov. Bruce Rauner in a case about unions, saying the governor has no authority to represent the state in court.
